fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend

Interface BuilderIndexProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BuilderIndexProviderImpl

    public interface BuilderIndexProvider

    An interface specifying an index provider builder.
    In order to follow the builder design pattern and for code reusability, an interface is used so that the implementation can be easily changed.

    The different parameters to give to the builder are the solution, the reaction rule, the reaction rule's fields, and the increment strategy of the index provider. See the associated setters for a detailed descrition.

    Author:
    Andreolli Cédric, Boulanger Chloé, Cléro Olivier, Guellier Antoine, Guilloux Sébastien, Templé Arthur
    See Also:
    IndexProvider, IncrementStrategy

    • Method Detail

      • getProduct

        fr.insa.rennes.info.chemical.backend.IndexProvider getProduct()
                                                              throws ChemicalException
        Returns the built index provider, following the parameters given. The different parameters are the solution, the reaction rule, the reaction rule's fields, and the increment strategy of the index provider. See the associated setters for a detailed description.
        Returns:
        The built index provider.
        Throws:
        ChemicalException
        See Also:
        setReactionRule(ReactionRule), setReactionRuleFields(Field[]), setSolution(Solution), setStrategy(Solution.Strategy)

      • setSolution

        void setSolution(Solution sol)
        Sets the solution parameter to build the index provider. The specified solution is the solution on which the index provider has to base itself to provide indexes on the reagents asked by the reaction rule.
        Parameters:
        sol - The solution on which the index provider has to iterate.

      • setReactionRule

        void setReactionRule(ReactionRule rr)
        Sets the reaction rule parameter to build the index provider. The reaction rule parameter specifies what is the reaction rule that needs reagents. Indeed, an index provider is always created in order to find reagents for a specific reaction rule.
        Parameters:
        rr - The reaction rule that needs reagents.

      • setReactionRuleFields

        void setReactionRuleFields(java.lang.reflect.Field[] rrFields)
        Sets the reaction rule's fields parameter to build the index provider. These fields are the reagents needed by the reaction rule. Basically, these are the attributes of the reaction rule class, without the ones annotated Dontreact.
        Parameters:
        rrFields - The reaction rule's fields
        See Also:
        Dontreact

      • setStrategy

        void setStrategy(Solution.Strategy strategy)
        Sets the iteration strategy parameter to build the index provider. The strategy determines in which order the reagents are given to the reaction rule. An ordered strategy will always give the same order of iteration and lead to the same execution result. A random strategy will allow indeterminism and possibly different results between two executions.
        Parameters:
        strategy - The iteration's order/strategy.
        See Also:
        Solution.Strategy

      • build

        void build()
           throws ChemicalException
        This function must build the product of the builder design pattern. This function may throw a ChemicalException if the builder needs more parameters before effectively building the product or if these parameters are incorrect. These parameters depend on the product built, and the builder implementation class have to provide the director a setter for each parameter.
        Throws:
        ChemicalException
